item.description:
Welcome to the Monday Happy Hours series!

This event is open to all, especially those who hate Mondays and especially for those who want to check out the different bar scenes in New Haven.

This week's location is:
GERONIMO Tequila Bar and Southwest Grill

Geronimo is a new bar in New Haven across the street from BAR and the Salvation Army store. It's on Crown Street between High and College. There wasn't a sign on the building as of 11/13 but there is a menu out front so it was easy to find.

From the Yale Daily News review:
The food is upgraded grill fare with a Southwest flavor (chili peppers) and the bar is an imposing U-shaped structure armed to the teeth with the liquors of Mexico. The menu boasts inventive drinks such as the passion fruit-jalapeno margarita, 85 kinds of Tequila, a good wine list from California and South America, some microbrews from the Southwest (the Flying Dog Ale is very good) and Mezcal.

DRINK SPECIALS:
From Ed: Geronimo will do $3 Tecate beers and $5 margaritas for us. Pretty good, their margaritas are usually $9-14 and beers are $5+! So this is a great chance to check this
place out and still watch the budget!

Contact info: Ed 203-583-9668
item.name: Monday 11/19 HH at Geronimo
